H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1342.def: = process by which plants and other inanimate objects increase in height

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H7411.def: = action by which humans cause (other) humans or objects to move in a particular direction, usually with force

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3050.def: = short form of {L:יהוה<SDBH:יהוה>}, only found in poetic texts

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H2176.def: poetic term: = words set to music

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5115.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = process by which humans are alive and well

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4818.def: = open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4005.def: = state in which persons or objects have been selected for their superior competencies or quality

H2883.def: = process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

H5488.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a reed-like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H7492.def: literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which a deity causes an enemy army to be totally defeated

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2040.def: = state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6192.def: = to take on the shape of a heap or pile

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H5067.def: = a large quantity of water, staying together as one heap as if it were a solid substance

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H5398.def: = causative process by which deities cause the wind to blow from one place to another

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H5777.def: = a heavy bluish-grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6382.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H5095.def: = action by which humans and their domestic animals journey from one place to the other

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6429.def: = land of the {L:Philistines<SDBH:פְּלִשְׁתִּי>}, situated along the coast of the Meditteranean and concentrated around the cities of {L:Gaza<SDBH:עַזָּה>}, {L:Gath<SDBH:גַּת>}, {L:Ekron<SDBH:עֶקְרֹון>}, {L:Ashdod<SDBH:אַשְׁדֹּוד>}, and {L:Ashkelon<SDBH:אַשְׁקְלֹון>}

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H441.def: = person in a position of leadership over a tribe or clan

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H4124.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} and one of his daughters; ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3667.def: = man; ◄ youngest son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>}; ► regarded as ancestor of the {L:Canaanites<SDBH:כְּנַעֲנִי>}

H4127.def: = process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H4349.def: = a firm location, suitable for building upon; ≈ often used for the place where the temple of God was built

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4813.def: = woman; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► elder sister of {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}

H5031.def: = female person speaking on behalf of a deity

H175.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}; brother of {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► first high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H8596.def: = musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4246.def: = action by which humans dance a round dance; ≈ associated with joy

H4813.def: = woman; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► elder sister of {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H1342.def: = process by which plants and other inanimate objects increase in height

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5488.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a reed-like plant, which grows in water and reaches a height of up to 3 m high; its fuzzy brown seed head becomes fluffy and blows away in the wind; ◄ Typha genus; ► used for baskets and mats; its roots are edible

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H7793.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄  made out of stone; ► provides protection and security; ≈ associated with insurmountable obstacles

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4785.def: = location ◄ in the wilderness of {L:Etham<SDBH:אֵתָם>} ► where the {L:Israelites<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} encamped shortly after crossing the {L:Sea of Reeds<SDBH:יָם־סוּף>} on their way from {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>} to {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}; here bitter water was made drinkable

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4985.def: = state in which food tastes well

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H5254.def: = action by which humans or deities make an effort to obtain information about (other) humans by observing them while they engage in a certain activity

38.gl: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H362.def: = location ◄ in {L:Sinai<SDBH:סִינַי>} Peninsula, not far from the {L:Sea of Reeds<SDBH:יָם־סוּף>}, containing twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; ► the {L:Israelites<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} encamped there on their way from {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>} to {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7657.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H8558.def: = a type of palm tree, which reaches a height of 10-20 m and has a cluster of large leaves at the top; ◄ Phoenix dactylifera; ► it is cultivated for its edible sweet fruit, about the size of a human thumb, which grows in clusters; ≈ it is symbol of elegance and grace

H2583.def: = state in which an individual or group of people dwells at a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
